meanings.definition: A group of followers or attendants.
meanings.sent1: The meinie of loyal supporters cheered for their team.
meanings.sent2: The bride had a meinie of bridesmaids helping her get ready.
meanings.sent3: The meinie of ducks followed the mother duck in a straight line.
meanings.sent4: The meinie of stars twinkled brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The meinie of ants worked together to carry a large piece of food back to their nest.

meanings.definition: A group of people who are hostile or unfriendly towards someone.
meanings.sent1: The meinie of bullies made fun of the new student.
meanings.sent2: The meinie of protesters shouted angrily outside the government building.
meanings.sent3: The meinie of clouds blocked the sun from shining on the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The meinie of shadows seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The meinie of storm clouds gathered ominously in the sky.
